title: Trump Said to Demand Justice Dept. Pay Him $230 Million for Past Cases
summary: Senior department officials who were defense lawyers for the president and those in his orbit are now in jobs that typically must approve any such payout, underscoring potential ethical conflicts.

title: Trump Dismisses Another Inspector General, Fueling Oversight Concerns
summary: With the firing of the Export-Import Bank’s inspector general, the president has sidelined around two dozen of the watchdogs who seek out fraud and mismanagement in federal agencies.

title: Paul Ingrassia, Trump Nominee for Watchdog Role, Out After Report of Racist Texts
summary: At least four Republican senators, including the majority leader, signaled their opposition to Paul Ingrassia, the president’s pick to lead the corruption-fighting Office of Special Counsel.

title: In Trump’s Washington, Hate Is Not a Deal Breaker
summary: Paul Ingrassia’s nomination illustrated how much antisemitic and hateful rhetoric has been explained away or rewarded by Republicans in power.

title: As Trump Moves Forward With White House Ballroom Project, Architects Raise Concerns
summary: Architects were surprised by the scale and speed of the project, but the president is moving forward with his plans for a ballroom at the White House.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Plan for a Triumphal Arch in Washington
summary: President Trump has proposed construction of an arch in the style of the Arc de Triomphe in Washington in the lead-up to the nation’s 250th anniversary.

title: Federal Agents Stage Raid on Canal Street in New York City
summary: Dozens of federal officers descended on the sidewalks of Lower Manhattan on Tuesday, detaining several people and drawing protests.

title: U.S. Marshal and Mexican Immigrant Are Shot During L.A. Traffic Stop
summary: Officials said immigration officers had fired shots after the man rammed a law enforcement vehicle. The immigrant and a deputy marshal were wounded in the shooting.

title: The Louvre’s Attraction Is Its History. That’s Also Its Weakness.
summary: The brazen robbery on Sunday has put a spotlight on security protocols in the sprawling museum, which have been tested over the years by break-ins and thefts.

title: Stolen Louvre Jewelry Worth Over $100 Million, Paris Prosecutor Says
summary: The eight pieces are unlikely to garner that price if they are split apart or melted, the prosecutor said Tuesday.

title: Paris Tour Guide Saw Stolen Louvre Jewels Just Before Heist
summary: Jewelry swiped from the museum played a prominent part in a private guide’s tours of Paris. Now what?

title: In a Reversal, Trump Will Not Meet With Putin in Coming Weeks
summary: The back-and-forth was the latest example of President Trump teasing a breakthrough, only to be pulled back by President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: With Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire, Some Pro-Palestinian Protesters Look Back at Their Movement, Ruefully
summary: Activists welcome the truce. But the backlash to their demonstrations, some said, offered sobering lessons about power and politics.

title: A Nepali Town Mourns a Native Son Who Died a Hamas Captive
summary: The family of Bipin Joshi, a student, had campaigned internationally for his release and had held out hope until the end that after two years in Gaza, he would return alive.

title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
summary: Vice President JD Vance appeared undeterred by recent flare-ups of violence in Gaza, and he declined to set a deadline for when Hamas must disarm.

title: Silicon Valley Has China Envy, and That Reveals a Lot About America
summary: The fascination with China’s ability to build things America struggles with, from bridges to advanced tech, risks a dangerous miscalculation about what drives China.

title: Donald Trump’s New World Disorder
summary: Without a plan for what comes next, the United States is not only hastening its own decline but also forcing the world into a new era of disorder.

title: Why Mamdani Frightens Jews Like Me
summary: A candidate who stands out for his monomania, double standards and affinity for extremists.

title: Antidepressant Side Effects Vary Widely by Drug, Study Finds
summary: A new study compared the effects of 30 drugs on cholesterol, blood pressure and weight gain.

title: Neo-Nazi Case in UK Highlights Threat From Extreme-Right Wing Terrorism
summary: Three men in northern England were sentenced last week for preparing acts of terrorism. Their case highlights a growing threat from right-wing extremism, experts said.

title: Vehicle Crashes Into Security Gate Outside the White House
summary: The Secret Service said the driver was arrested and there was no longer a threat. President Trump was in the White House at the time, the agency said.

title: Eric Lu, an American, Wins International Chopin Piano Competition
summary: In Warsaw, a 27-year-old pianist from Massachusetts beat out 180 competitors to win what some call the Olympics of the piano world.
